name: Button
description: The Button component should be used as the primary call-to-action in a form, or as a user interaction mechanism.

props.name: type
props.doc: The type HTML attribute. Defaults to `button` for legacy reasons.

props.name: text
props.doc: The content of the button can be a string or a React Element.

props.name: aria-label
props.doc: Required if there is no text in the button. If `text` and `children` are undefined, setting the `title` property will automatically set `aria-label` with the same value.

props.name: title
props.doc: Required if there is no text in the button. If `text` and `children` are undefined, setting the `title` property will automatically set `aria-label` with the same value.

props.name: variant
props.doc: Defines the kind of button. Possible values are `primary`, `secondary`, `tertiary` and `signal`. Defaults to `primary` (or `secondary` if icon only).

props.name: size
props.doc: The size of the button. For now there is `small`, `medium`, `default` and `large`.

props.name: icon
props.doc: To be included in the button. [Primary Icons](/icons/primary) can be set as a string (e.g. `icon="chevron_right"`), other icons should be set as React elements.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: Position of icon inside the button. Set to `left` or `right`. Tertiary button variant also supports `top`. Defaults to `right` if not set.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: Define icon width and height. Defaults to 16px.

props.name: href
props.doc: If you want the button to behave as a link. Use with caution! A link should normally visually be a link and not a button.

props.name: target
props.doc: When button behaves as a link. Used to specify where to open the linked document, specified by `href`. Possible values are `_self`, `_blank`, `_parent` and `_top`.

props.name: rel
props.doc: When button behaves as a link. Used to specify the relationship between a linked resource and the current document. Examples(non-exhaustive list) of values are `nofollow`, `search`, and `tag`.

props.name: to
props.doc: Use this property only if you are using a router Link component as the `element` that uses the `to` property to declare the navigation url.

props.name: wrap
props.doc: If set to `true` the button text will wrap in to new lines if the overflow point is reached. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: Set it to `true` in order to stretch the button to the available space. Defaults to false.

props.name: bounding
props.doc: Set it to `true` in order to extend the bounding box (above the visual button background). You may also look into the HTML class `dnb-button__bounding` if it needs some CSS customization in order to get the particular button right for your use-case.

props.name: element
props.doc: Only meant to be used for special use cases. Defaults to `button` or `a` depending if href is set or not.

props.name: custom_content
props.doc: If you need to inject completely custom markup (React Element) into the button component. You have then to handle alignment and styling by yourself.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: tooltip
props.doc: Provide a string or a React Element to be shown as the tooltip content.

props.name: status
props.doc: Set it to either `status="error"` or a text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: The [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

events.name: on_click
events.doc: Will be called on a click event. Returns an object with the native event: `{ event }`.
